abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Technical Assistance Project
            will assist the Government to address some of the major
            weaknesses in its capacity to manage and rehabilitate the
            economy. The dual project objectives aim at: (a)
            strengthening the Government's decision making,
            planning, project preparation and implementation
            capabilities through external assistance; and (b)
            transferring skills to Ugandans through training. To achieve
            these objectives, the credit will finance high priority
            sub-projects. These sub-projects will concentrate on
            improving the capacity of certain government ministries to
            manage the Ugandan economy; strengthening the planning and
            project preparation capacities of sector ministries; and
            enhancing the Institute of Public Administration's
            ability to provide training in Uganda. The project will
            finance technical expertise provided by expatriate advisors
            or consulting firms, training and equipment.
